Pier started as the Smallwiki project by Lukas Renggli as part of his University work. It was a fully object-oriented wiki framework designed to be extensible. . It is a web application in the programming language Smalltalk. It is distributed as free and open-source software under an MIT License.
Key features
Pier has several features that differentiates it from other CMSes:
* Ease of customization, for example custom links
* Embedded components including pages
* Since it is written in Smalltalk, at approximately 100k lines of code it can be comprehended by one person
